PageTitle: interface (BGP Flow Specification interface group view)
FuncDef:
The interface command adds an interface to a BGP Flow Specification interface group.
The undo interface command deletes an interface from a BGP Flow Specification interface group.
By default, no interfaces are added to a BGP Flow Specification interface group.
ParentView: BGP Flow Specification interface group view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the type of an interface.
-

Specifies the number of an interface.
-

Specifies the name of an interface.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Without a BGP Flow Specification interface group, the traffic filtering rules configured for BGP Flow Specification routes take effect globally, not on a specified interface. If a BGP Flow Specification interface group is configured, the traffic filtering rules configured for BGP Flow Specification routes also take effect on a specified interface. In this manner, traffic can be forwarded based on the rules of the BGP Flow Specification routes on the specified interface.
After a BGP Flow Specification interface group is created using the flow-interface-group command, you need to run the interface command to add an interface to the group.
